author: Nistula Hebbar
text:
Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday attacked the government’s recently announced amnesty scheme for black money holders, mocking it as the “Fair and Lovely [after the fairness cream] Yojana.”

Speaking during a debate on the Motion of Thanks to the President for his address to both Houses of Parliament, Mr. Gandhi said: “This Fair and Lovely Yojana is designed to turn black money into white, whereas before the elections, Mr. Modi had promised us that he would make sure that those with black money would be prosecuted.”

On the Naga accord, Mr. Gandhi said Congress president Sonia Gandhi and he were both surprised that the signing of the accord was not only not discussed with chief ministers of north-eastern States but also Home Minister Rajnath Singh. “And now, where is the accord. Gone with the wind. Bye bye accord,” he said.

He exhorted the Prime Minister to “listen to his colleagues in the Cabinet, the professionals in the government” and to the Opposition “across the aisle.” “We are not your enemies,” he said.

Mr. Gandhi, whose visit to Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) after some of its students had been charged with sedition had created misgivings in certain sections of his own party, made an eloquent case for a less muscular and monolithic version of nationalism than espoused by the ruling BJP. “When I went to JNU, some members of the ABVP showed me black flags and abused me. I protected our national flag by allowing them the freedom to express their feelings about me,” he said.
title: Rahul targets Modi over black money, sedition row
